p: Not surprisingly, however, for a journal that seeks to address science‐informed decision making, almost a third of the editorials explored the role of science or scientists (very different things) in regulation, decision making, policy, and communication. The foci and viewpoints were wide‐ranging, often depending on the sector of the authors—academics, for example, often had different takes than did regulators or consultants. We mused about the importance of making data transparent and relevant, while avoiding normative science. We explored science communication and stakeholder engagement, evaluating how we can better support societal decision making.
